Reviews.Content: Nice stay at the Villa Orange!       Bedroom at the Villa Orange
Reviews.Author: Grammis-Hammer

Reviews.Content: Very pleasant in a residential area Very pleasant stay on a one-day stopover in Frankfurt. The hotel is located in a calm residential area (construction mentioned in a previous review is now finished). The hotel is a short walk to the U5 tram line, but we like walking and found the walk to the central business district was only about 15 minutes. Very comfortable room and bed, and a greeat bath. Copious breakfast buffet.We would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: stantongeddes

Reviews.Content: Cosy and quiet business hotel Villa Orange is a small hotel in a renovated town house, close to the centre of Frankfurt. Not far away from the Zeil shopping district, and not very far from Frankfurt's skyscrapers and the old Opera.All rooms are different, but all of them offer high comfort and nicely deisgned interiors. The free wireless Internet is also a wonderful service.
Reviews.Author: Tom_Terryn

Reviews.Content: Suitable for short stay We stayed at the Villa Orange twice, each for one night while on a layover in Frankfurt. The hotel is situated in a busy residential section. While inside the hotel was very quiet, with nearby construction and the traffic outside - it is definitely not a place for peace and relaxation. The staff while very professional, definitely come across as somewhat cold and hardly welcoming. Even the young ladies attending to the buffet in the morning, were somewhat stand-offish. Our first visit, we stayed in a deluxe room that was quite large, with a huge bathroom and plenty of light. It was comfortable and very clean. Between the heat and the noise, it was the first time I wished they was AC. On our way home, we stayed in a smaller comfort room upstairs. Even that room was a generous size with a large bathroom and clawfoot tub. The hotel guests tend to be European business travelers, thus it is fairly quiet. It is not far from the main boulevard with shops and restaurants. Would definitely recommend taking note of where your hotel is when you go out, especially since the street names are somewhat different on the maps. Not too far, is an excellent Gelato shop frequented by the locals.While there was nothing terribly wrong with this hotel, I think next time I would opt for something a little larger, perhaps more welcoming towards tourists such as myself.
Reviews.Author: deardiva

Reviews.Content: NICE BOUTIQUE HOTEL We have just returned from a 3 nights stay at the hotel. The hotel is very nice with a nice lobby. the room was very nice , and the bathroom big and new. there was no minibar, but only coffee and tea.some of the rooms have a balcony and the others are near emergency stairs.the breakfast is very good and the breakfast room is very nice.the hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the zeil in a quiet residential area and near the bergershtrasse, with lots of very nice restaurants.we can recommend two italians:bistro pizzeria ruccola, at number 11 bellamia , at number 67
Reviews.Author: OBERMAN

Reviews.Content: Wonderful!!! Great location and price(150 euros/night)...complimentary breakfast was vunderbar!!!best croisants I have ever had(bar none even in Paris)Had an attic room(for 3) with about 500 sq. ft of room, tons of hot water and pressure, beds were a bit hard but sheets and comforters were very nice...was easy to find and located in a nice upscale residential neighborhood...looked to popular for business folk...
Reviews.Author: Orygunion

Reviews.Content: Great Choice We stayed at Villa Orange one night in November 2006 on our way to Spain because of the Trip Advisor recommendations we read. We flew across the Atlantic and arrived in Frankfurt at 8:00 am. Even though check in was not until 3:00pm, we went directly to the hotel and arrived at 9:00am. The reception we received couldn鈥檛 have been warmer or friendlier. They said they would give us the first available room and suggested we enjoy their continental breakfast, which was excellent and far better than most continental breakfasts, while we waited for the room to be made up. We received our room key at 9:45 am. The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. We really liked our room as well as the proximity to downtown. Walking downtown was easy and enjoyable. Our choice of hotels was an excellent one, far better than we hoped.A previous reviewer suggested going to the Exhil Restaurant around the corner. We did this and found the manager both haughty and rude. We wondered if it was because we don鈥檛 speak German. We left and found an Italian restaurant, the Portofino around another corner of the hotel, and were very pleased.I can鈥檛 recommend the Villa Orange strongly enough.
Reviews.Author: GreatAdvice

Reviews.Content: Thank you Villa Orange! Thank you all at Villa Orange for making my stay so pleasant! The staff was really resourceful in helping me find the things that I needed around the city for my trade show installation. Be sure not to miss EXHIL, a wonderful little restaurant around the corner from the hotel!It will exceed your expectations with its fine cuisine, with the added bonus of having a hip/casual decor!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Doesn't live up to other reviews! Very disappointed! I recently stayed at Villa Orange after reading many positive reviews. Photos on the website also made it appear a lovely boutique hotel.On check-in the staff were abrupt, disinterested and rude. There was no attempt at welcoming guests to the hotel and no explanation of facilities.Whilst the bathroom was pleasant, the room itself was tired, shabby and unappealing. The bed had a single duvet and pillow plonked in the middle with greying covers - not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel. In addition, the road outside was very noisy and noise from inside the hotel was also a problem. As a business woman travelling on my own, key criterion for any hotel is that it feels safe and welcoming. Unfortunately Villa Orange did not live up to this.I would not recommend this hotel to other guests, particularly as there are plenty of other options in Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: pleasant stay Villa Orange is a pleasant small hotel hotel, conveniantly located in city centre Frankfurt. The staff were pleasant and room was, while not overly large (I booked one in the Comfort range, the regular ones must be tiny), well furnished and bright and included a balcony. As the weather was quiet hot during my stay I would have liked some airconditioning (or a fan). The breakfast included a wide variety of cold meats, cheeses, fruits etc. (no hot opetion though). Breakfast in Germany always comes out on top! I would definately consider Villa Orange again when in Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: Dubskin

Reviews.Content: Great stay!! I stayed at Villa Orange in February and was extremely impressed! The staff were soooo friendly and welcoming, keeping the chocolate bowl on reception well stocked for us, always handy!The rooms were funky and well designed, a beautiful cosy library to relax in is downstairs with many books from all over the world.And the breakfast..wow! I rolled out of there!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel I just visited Villa Orange this past Ambiente Trade show. Only 5 stops from Messe on the U4. Hotel is in very residential area not many restaurants within close walking distance. Hotel was very clean, decor was fresh and breakfast was great. Only two minor gripes no internet access in room and the room price was too much for its location.
Reviews.Author: emannh

Reviews.Content: Superb weekend value Stayed at the hotel during the Frankfurt Christmas market. Good location 10 mins walk from town and 2 minutes from bus and tram line. Decided to stay in a superior room which was excellent value for money (I think it's more expensive during the week) - large room with large comfy bed, crisp white linen, modern light wood furniture. Bathroom very clean and spacious with a separate shower and 2 sinks. Huge continental breakfast choice.
Reviews.Author: Stuut

Reviews.Content: Pleasant personality Very pleasant mid-size hotel about 15 minutes walk from town centre in a nice residential area. Well designed and relaxing interior and definately for the literary minded - books in every room and a well stocked library. Just make sure you book a parking space when travelling by car - they only have five and parking in the surrounding streets is a nightmare! Nearest multi-storey carpark is ten minutes walk away though one is under construction much closer.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
